body:
Comment 7 by **lucio.dere**: 
I will now count my chickens before they are hatched: building Go on the faster NetBSD
server, but with GO386=387 has almost completed the tests successfully.  On the slower
NetBSD server, the tests don't cut it, so that is no benchmark - but the build does
complete successfully, at least.

It remains to check under Ubuntu (again, GO386=387) and Plan 9 (I'm way behind on that,
so I expect the worst) where GO386=387 is the default in at least one instance.  Testing
on Plan 9 is not an option right now, many things are still broken.

I'll be submitting a patch for review as soon as I have completed the practical tests.

Lucio.
